trans-unit.source: Please configure a valid dice expression first
Your character's name. Displayed in presets that use character values.
Your character's level (1-20). Determines the Proficiency Bonus: Lvl 1-4: +2, Lvl 5-8: +3, Lvl 9-12: +4, Lvl 13-16: +5, Lvl 17-20: +6.
Automatically calculated from level and added to rolls where you are proficient (e.g., attacks, saving throws, skill checks).
Your character's six core attributes. The modifier is calculated from the score: (Score - 10) / 2, rounded down. E.g., 14 = +2, 8 = -1.
No character created yet. Fill out the fields and your data will be saved automatically.
Are you sure you want to reset the current character? This action cannot be undone.
Number of dice in this group to be rolled (e.g., 2 for 2d6).
The type of die (d4, d6, d8, d10, d12, d20, d100). The number indicates the number of sides.
Allows keeping or dropping certain dice results. Useful for mechanics like "4d6, drop lowest" during character creation.
Keep Highest/Lowest: Keeps the highest/lowest dice. Drop Highest/Lowest: Discards the highest/lowest dice.
Number of dice to keep or drop.
A fixed bonus or penalty added to the roll result. Can be entered manually or calculated from your character sheet.
With Advantage, you roll 2d20 and take the higher result. With Disadvantage, you take the lower result.
The Difficulty Class you need to meet or exceed. Shows your success probability in real-time.
Manual: Enter a fixed value. Character: Automatically calculates the modifier from your character sheet.
A fixed numeric value that is added (positive) or subtracted (negative) from the roll result.
Please fill out the character sheet in the Character Sheet tab first
Select the ability whose modifier should be used (e.g., STR for melee attacks, DEX for ranged attacks).
Enable this for rolls where your character is proficient (proficient attacks, trained skills, saving throws).
Extra bonuses from other sources such as magic items, spells, or class features.
Filters the preset list by categories. Select "All Categories" to see all presets.
Give your preset a descriptive name, e.g., "Longsword Attack" or "Fireball Damage".
Categorize your preset for better organization. You can select multiple categories.
No presets saved yet. Save your favorite dice configurations!
Are you sure you want to delete the preset ""? This action cannot be undone.
Configure dice in the Dice Roller to see probabilities.
No rolls yet. Start rolling some dice!
Are you sure you want to clear the entire roll history? This action cannot be undone.
No statistics available. Roll some dice first!
Start a new session? This will reset the session timer.
Install this app on your device
A new version is available! Refresh to update.
An error occurred. Please refresh the page.
